name: pallidly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that looks pale, unhealthy, and not attractive: Statues of mythological figures gleamed pallidly all along the path. He sat hunched pallidly over the bench in his workshop under the light of a desk lamp.
in a way that shows no enthusiasm or excitement: Colourful language and pictures may be more entertaining than pallidly presented information, but are not necessarily more persuasive. I smiled at him, and he smiled back pallidly.
More examplesFewer examplesThe boy who had fainted smiled pallidly at him. The clouds of smoke drifted pallidly away in the moonlight.
